title: Labor calls for mandatory reporting of child abuse in detention centres: Richard Marles
text:
Tuesday 13 October 2015 8:06AM (view full episode) 
The extraordinary protest by doctors and nurses at Melbourne's Royal Children's Hospital has refocussed attention on the plight of children in immigration detention. 
It's helped prompt a change of heart by the Federal Opposition, which now wants to mandate the reporting of child abuse in all offshore and mainland facilities. 
In Parliament, Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull has conceded the Government's border protection policies are 'harsh', but are intended to save lives. 
The push by Labor to enshrine mandatory reporting of child abuse is being driven by Labor's Shadow Immigration Minister Richard Marles. 
Richard Marles joins Fran Kelly on RN Breakfast .
